a.g: Alif, Lam, Ra. [This is] a Book whose verses are perfected and then presented in detail from [one who is] Wise and Acquainted.
[Through a messenger, saying], "Do not worship except Allah. Indeed, I am to you from Him a warner and a bringer of good tidings,"

And [saying], "Seek forgiveness of your Lord and repent to Him, [and] He will let you enjoy a good provision for a specified term and give every doer of favor his favor. But if you turn away, then indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a great Day.
To Allah is your return, and He is over all things competent."

Unquestionably, they the disbelievers turn away their breasts to hide themselves from Him. Unquestionably, [even] when they cover themselves in their clothing, Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
And there is no creature on earth but that upon Allah is its provision, and He knows its place of dwelling and place of storage. All is in a clear register.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 1
Indeed, woe to you, O soul [nafs]! How astonishing is your hypocrisy [nifaq] and your false pretenses! For you claim faith [iman] with your tongue, yet the mark of hypocrisy is manifest upon you. Did not your Master and Lord say to you: "And there is no creature on earth but that its provision [rizq] is upon Allah" (11:6)? And did He not say concerning the matter of the Hereafter: "And that for man is only what he has striven for" (53:39)? Thus, He has guaranteed for you the matter of the world [dunya] specifically, and diverted you from striving within it. Yet you have belied Him with your actions, and you have become one who scrambles greedily in seeking it, like the scramble of one who is bewildered and reckless. And He has entrusted the matter of the Hereafter to your striving, yet you have turned away from it with the turning away of one who is deluded and contemptuous. What is this from the signs of faith [iman], if faith were merely with the tongue? For why then would the hypocrites [munafiqun] be in the lowest depth of the Fire?

a.g: And it is He who created the heavens and the earth in six days - and His Throne had been upon water - that He might test you as to which of you is best in deed. But if you say, "Indeed, you are resurrected after death," those who disbelieve will surely say, "This is not but obvious magic."

And if We hold back from them the punishment for a limited time, they will surely say, "What detains it?" Unquestionably, on the Day it comes to them, it will not be averted from them, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 8
Indeed, among them is the ambiguous [al-mubham], which is the expression shared between a meaning from a word or a letter. As for the word, such as 'the thing' [al-shay'], 'the companion' [al-qarīn], 'the community' [al-ummah], 'the spirit' [al-rūḥ], and their like... And as for 'the community' [al-ummah], it is applied in eight aspects... And 'the community' [al-ummah] is the period and the time, as in His, exalted is He, saying: "Until a numbered community [ummah]" (11:8).
Vol1 book 8

a.g: And if We give man a taste of mercy from Us and then We withdraw it from him, indeed, he is despairing and ungrateful.
But if We give him a taste of favor after hardship has touched him, he will surely say, "Bad times have left me." Indeed, he is exultant and boastful -
Except for those who are patient and do righteous deeds; those will have forgiveness and great reward.

Then would you possibly leave [out] some of what is revealed to you, or is your breast constrained by it because they say, "Why has there not been sent down to him a treasure or come with him an angel?" But you are only a warner. And Allah is Disposer of all things.
Or do they say, "He invented it"? Say, "Then bring ten surahs like it that have been invented and call upon [for assistance] whomever you can besides Allah, if you should be truthful."
And if they do not respond to you - then know that the Qur'an was revealed with the knowledge of Allah and that there is no deity except Him. Then, would you [not] be Muslims?
Whoever desires the life of this world and its adornments - We fully repay them for their deeds therein, and they therein will not be deprived.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol3 book 7a
Indeed, the narrator of this hadith entered upon Mu'awiyah and narrated that to him, and he wept until his soul [nafs] was nearly departing. Then he said: "Allah has spoken the truth when He said: 'Whoever desires the life of this world [al-hayat al-dunya] and its adornment...' the verse."
Vol3 book 8a
Indeed, whoever desires the life of this world [al-dunya] and its adornment, We will repay them in full for their deeds therein, and they will not be wronged therein. Those are the ones for whom there is nothing in the Hereafter [al-akhirah] except the Fire, and what they have done therein is wasted, and worthless is what they used to do. And this, too, by its generality, encompasses the love of status [al-jah], for it is a greater pleasure than the pleasures of the life of this world [al-dunya] and a greater adornment than its adornment.

a.g: Those are the ones for whom there is not in the Hereafter but the Fire. And lost is what they did therein, and worthless is what they used to do.

So is one who [stands] upon a clear evidence from his Lord [like the aforementioned]? And a witness from Him follows it, and before it was the Scripture of Moses to lead and as mercy. Those [believers in the former revelations] believe in the Qur'an. But whoever disbelieves in it from the [various] factions - the Fire is his promised destination. So be not in doubt about it. Indeed, it is the truth from your Lord, but most of the people do not believe.

And who is more unjust than he who invents a lie about Allah? Those will be presented before their Lord, and the witnesses will say, "These are the ones who lied against their Lord." Unquestionably, the curse of Allah is upon the wrongdoers.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 8
Indeed, as for the disbelievers [al-kafirun] and the hypocrites [al-munafiqun], the witnesses [al-ashhad] will say: "These are the ones who lied against their Lord. Indeed, the curse of Allah is upon the wrongdoers [al-zalimin]."
j2 k05
Indeed, as for the disbelievers [al-kafirun] and the hypocrites [al-munafiqun], the witnesses [al-ashhad] will say: "These are the ones who lied against their Lord. Indeed, the curse of Allah is upon the wrongdoers [al-zalimin]."

a.g: Who averted [people] from the way of Allah and sought to make it [seem] deviant while they, concerning the Hereafter, were disbelievers.
Those were not causing failure [to Allah] on earth, nor did they have besides Allah any protectors. For them the punishment will be multiplied. They were not able to hear, nor did they see.
Those are the ones who will have lost themselves, and lost from them is what they used to invent.
Assuredly, it is they in the Hereafter who will be the greatest losers.
Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds and humbled themselves to their Lord - those are the companions of Paradise; they will abide eternally therein.
The example of the two parties is like the blind and deaf, and the seeing and hearing. Are they equal in comparison? Then, will you not remember?
And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Indeed, I am to you a clear warner
That you not worship except Allah. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a painful day."

So the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, "We do not see you but as a man like ourselves, and we do not see you followed except by those who are the lowest of us [and] at first suggestion. And we do not see in you over us any merit; rather, we think you are liars."

He said, "O my people have you considered: if I should be upon clear evidence from my Lord while He has given me mercy from Himself but it has been made unapparent to you, should we force it upon you while you are averse to it?

And O my people, I ask not of you for it any wealth. My reward is not but from Allah. And I am not one to drive away those who have believed. Indeed, they will meet their Lord, but I see that you are a people behaving ignorantly.
And O my people, who would protect me from Allah if I drove them away? Then will you not be reminded?

And I do not tell you that I have the depositories [containing the provision] of Allah or that I know the unseen, nor do I tell you that I am an angel, nor do I say of those upon whom your eyes look down that Allah will never grant them any good. Allah is most knowing of what is within their souls. Indeed, I would then be among the wrongdoers."
They said, "O Noah, you have disputed us and been frequent in dispute of us. So bring us what you threaten us, if you should be of the truthful."
He said, "Allah will only bring it to you if He wills, and you will not cause [Him] failure.
And my advice will not benefit you - although I wished to advise you - If Allah should intend to put you in error. He is your Lord, and to Him you will be returned."
Or do they say [about Prophet Muhammad], "He invented it"? Say, "If I have invented it, then upon me is [the consequence of] my crime; but I am innocent of what [crimes] you commit."
And it was revealed to Noah that, "No one will believe from your people except those who have already believed, so do not be distressed by what they have been doing.
And construct the ship under Our observation and Our inspiration and do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are [to be] drowned."
And he constructed the ship, and whenever an assembly of the eminent of his people passed by him, they ridiculed him. He said, "If you ridicule us, then we will ridicule you just as you ridicule.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book2
Indeed, the example of the stages of creation in their pleasure is what We mention: It is that the child, at the beginning of his movement and discernment, manifests within him an instinct [gharīzah] by which he delights in play and amusement [lahw], to the point that this becomes for him more delightful than all other things. Then, after that, appears the pleasure of adornment, wearing clothes, and riding mounts, and he holds as insignificant with it the pleasure of play. Then, after that, appears the pleasure of intercourse and the desire for women, and he abandons with it all that came before it in striving to reach it. Then appears the pleasure of leadership [riyāsah], superiority, and rivalry in increase [takāthur], and it is the last of the pleasures of the world [dunyā], its highest and its strongest, as the Exalted has said: "Know that the life of this world is but play and amusement, adornment and mutual boasting among you, and rivalry in increase..." [Quran 57:20]. Then, after this, another instinct [gharīzah] manifests, by which he perceives the pleasure of knowing [maʿrifah] God, the Exalted, and knowing His actions, and he holds as insignificant with it all that came before it. Thus, every later stage is stronger, and this is the final one. For the love of play appears at the age of discernment, the love of women and adornment at the age of puberty, the love of leadership [riyāsah] after twenty, and the love of knowledge [ʿulūm] near forty, and it is the ultimate, highest goal. And just as the child laughs at one who abandons play and busies himself with dalliance with women and the pursuit of leadership [riyāsah]; so too do the leaders [ruʾasāʾ] laugh at one who abandons leadership [riyāsah] and busies himself with the knowledge [maʿrifah] of God, the Exalted. And the knowers [ʿārifūn] say: "If you mock us, indeed we mock you as you mock, and you will come to know."

a.g: And you are going to know who will get a punishment that will disgrace him [on earth] and upon whom will descend an enduring punishment [in the Hereafter]."

[So it was], until when Our command came and the oven overflowed, We said, "Load upon the ship of each [creature] two mates and your family, except those about whom the word has preceded, and [include] whoever has believed." But none had believed with him, except a few.
And [Noah] said, "Embark therein; in the name of Allah is its course and its anchorage. Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."
And it sailed with them through waves like mountains, and Noah called to his son who was apart [from them], "O my son, come aboard with us and be not with the disbelievers."

[But] he said, "I will take refuge on a mountain to protect me from the water." [Noah] said, "There is no protector today from the decree of Allah, except for whom He gives mercy." And the waves came between them, and he was among the drowned.

And it was said, "O earth, swallow your water, and O sky, withhold [your rain]." And the water subsided, and the matter was accomplished, and the ship came to rest on the [mountain of] Judiyy. And it was said, "Away with the wrongdoing people."
And Noah called to his Lord and said, "My Lord, indeed my son is of my family; and indeed, Your promise is true; and You are the most just of judges!"

He said, "O Noah, indeed he is not of your family; indeed, he is [one whose] work was other than righteous, so ask Me not for that about which you have no knowledge. Indeed, I advise you, lest you be among the ignorant."
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol3 book 10a
Indeed, the deluded one [al-maghruur] forgets that Noah, peace be upon him, desired to have his son accompany him in the Ark, but it was not willed, and he was among the drowned. "So he said, 'My Lord, indeed my son is of my family [ahli].'" So the Most High said, "O Noah, indeed he is not of your family [ahlik]; indeed, he is a deed not righteous ['amal ghayr saalih]."

a.g: [Noah] said, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from asking that of which I have no knowledge. And unless You forgive me and have mercy upon me, I will be among the losers."

It was said, "O Noah, disembark in security from Us and blessings upon you and upon nations [descending] from those with you. But other nations [of them] We will grant enjoyment; then there will touch them from Us a painful punishment."
That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. You knew it not, neither you nor your people, before this. So be patient; indeed, the [best] outcome is for the righteous.
And to 'Aad [We sent] their brother Hud. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. You are not but inventors [of falsehood].
O my people, I do not ask you for it any reward. My reward is only from the one who created me. Then will you not reason?

And O my people, ask forgiveness of your Lord and then repent to Him. He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in showers and increase you in strength [added] to your strength. And do not turn away, [being] criminals."
They said, "O Hud, you have not brought us clear evidence, and we are not ones to leave our gods on your say-so. Nor are we believers in you.
We only say that some of our gods have possessed you with evil." He said, "Indeed, I call Allah to witness, and witness [yourselves] that I am free from whatever you associate with Allah
Other than Him. So plot against me all together; then do not give me respite.
Indeed, I have relied upon Allah, my Lord and your Lord. There is no creature but that He holds its forelock. Indeed, my Lord is on a path [that is] straight."
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 9
Indeed, He ﷺ said—as witnessed by Abu Hurairah and Abu Sa'id al-Khudri—: "When the servant [al-'abd] says, 'There is no god but Allah, and Allah is greater [Allahu akbar],' Allah, Mighty and Majestic, says, 'My servant has spoken truthfully. There is no god but Me, and I am greater.' And when the servant says, 'There is no god but Allah alone, with no partner to Him [la sharika lah],' the Exalted says, 'My servant has spoken truthfully. There is no god but Me alone, with no partner to Me.' And when he says, 'There is no god but Allah, and there is no power and no strength except by Allah [la hawla wa la quwwata illa billah],' Allah, Glorified is He, says, 'My servant has spoken truthfully. There is no power and no strength except by Me.' And whoever says them at the moment of death, the Fire [al-nar] will not touch him." And He ﷺ said: "O 'Abdullah ibn Qais—or O Abu Musa—shall I not guide you to a treasure from the treasures of Paradise [kanz min kunuz al-jannah]?" He said, "Yes, indeed." He said, "Say: 'There is no power and no strength except by Allah.'" And in another narration: "Shall I not teach you a word from a treasure beneath the Throne [kanz tahta al-'arsh]: 'There is no power and no strength except by Allah'?" And Abu Hurairah said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Shall I not guide you to a deed from the treasures of Paradise from beneath the Throne? The saying: 'There is no power and no strength except by Allah.' Allah, the Exalted, says: 'My servant has submitted [aslama] and surrendered [istaslama].'" And Mujahid said: "When a man leaves his house and says, 'In the name of Allah [bismillah],' the angel says, 'You are guided [hudita].' And when he says, 'I have placed my trust in Allah [tawakkaltu 'ala Allah],' the angel says, 'You are sufficed [kufita].' And when he says, 'There is no power and no strength except by Allah,' the angel says, 'You are protected [wuqita].' Then the devils [al-shayatin] disperse from him and say, 'What do you want with a man who has been guided, sufficed, and protected? You have no way to him.' Indeed, my Lord is upon a straight path [sirat mustaqim]."

a.g: But if they turn away, [say], "I have already conveyed that with which I was sent to you. My Lord will give succession to a people other than you, and you will not harm Him at all. Indeed my Lord is, over all things, Guardian."
And when Our command came, We saved Hud and those who believed with him, by mercy from Us; and We saved them from a harsh punishment.
And that was 'Aad, who rejected the signs of their Lord and disobeyed His messengers and followed the order of every obstinate tyrant.
And they were [therefore] followed in this world with a curse and [as well] on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, 'Aad denied their Lord; then away with 'Aad, the people of Hud.
a.ihya:

The scholars said, perhaps that is due to what is in Surah Hud of severe warning [i'bad], like His saying, exalted is He: "Behold! Away with 'Ad, the people of Hud!" — along with His knowledge, may He be glorified and exalted, that if He willed, they would not have associated others with Him, for if He willed, He could have guided every soul [nafs] to its guidance [hudaha].

a.g: And to Thamud [We sent] their brother Salih. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. He has produced you from the earth and settled you in it, so ask forgiveness of Him and then repent to Him. Indeed, my Lord is near and responsive."

They said, "O Salih, you were among us a man of promise before this. Do you forbid us to worship what our fathers worshipped? And indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting doubt."

He said, "O my people, have you considered: if I should be upon clear evidence from my Lord and He has given me mercy from Himself, who would protect me from Allah if I disobeyed Him? So you would not increase me except in loss.
And O my people, this is the she-camel of Allah - [she is] to you a sign. So let her feed upon Allah 's earth and do not touch her with harm, or you will be taken by an impending punishment."
But they hamstrung her, so he said, "Enjoy yourselves in your homes for three days. That is a promise not to be denied."

So when Our command came, We saved Salih and those who believed with him, by mercy from Us, and [saved them] from the disgrace of that day. Indeed, it is your Lord who is the Powerful, the Exalted in Might.
And the shriek seized those who had wronged, and they became within their homes [corpses] fallen prone
As if they had never prospered therein. Unquestionably, Thamud denied their Lord; then, away with Thamud.

a.g: And certainly did Our messengers come to Abraham with good tidings; they said, "Peace." He said, "Peace," and did not delay in bringing [them] a roasted calf.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

j2 k01
Indeed, one of the two meanings in His, the Exalted's, saying, "Has there come to you the story of the honored guests [diyf] of Abraham?" is that they were honored [ukrimu] by the hastening of food to them. This is indicated by His, the Exalted's, saying, "So he did not delay in bringing a roasted calf [al-'ijl al-hanidh]," and His saying, "Then he slipped away to his family and brought a fat calf [al-'ijl al-samin]." And "slipping away" [al-rawghan] is going with speed, and it is said: in secrecy. And it is said: he brought a thigh of meat. And it is only called a calf [al-'ijl] because he hastened it [‘ajjalahu] and did not delay.

a.g: But when he saw their hands not reaching for it, he distrusted them and felt from them apprehension. They said, "Fear not. We have been sent to the people of Lot."
And his Wife was standing, and she smiled. Then We gave her good tidings of Isaac and after Isaac, Jacob.
She said, "Woe to me! Shall I give birth while I am an old woman and this, my husband, is an old man? Indeed, this is an amazing thing!"
They said, "Are you amazed at the decree of Allah? May the mercy of Allah and His blessings be upon you, people of the house. Indeed, He is Praiseworthy and Honorable."
And when the fright had left Abraham and the good tidings had reached him, he began to argue with Us concerning the people of Lot.
Indeed, Abraham was forbearing, grieving and [frequently] returning [to Allah].
[The angels said], "O Abraham, give up this [plea]. Indeed, the command of your Lord has come, and indeed, there will reach them a punishment that cannot be repelled."
And when Our messengers, [the angels], came to Lot, he was anguished for them and felt for them great discomfort and said, "This is a trying day."

And his people came hastening to him, and before [this] they had been doing evil deeds. He said, "O my people, these are my daughters; they are purer for you. So fear Allah and do not disgrace me concerning my guests. Is there not among you a man of reason?"
They said, "You have already known that we have not concerning your daughters any claim, and indeed, you know what we want."
He said, "If only I had against you some power or could take refuge in a strong support."

The angels said, "O Lot, indeed we are messengers of your Lord; [therefore], they will never reach you. So set out with your family during a portion of the night and let not any among you look back - except your wife; indeed, she will be struck by that which strikes them. Indeed, their appointment is [for] the morning. Is not the morning near?"
So when Our command came, We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of layered hard clay, [which were]
Marked from your Lord. And Allah 's punishment is not from the wrongdoers [very] far.

And to Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu'ayb. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. And do not decrease from the measure and the scale. Indeed, I see you in prosperity, but indeed, I fear for you the punishment of an all-encompassing Day.
And O my people, give full measure and weight in justice and do not deprive the people of their due and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption.
What remains [lawful] from Allah is best for you, if you would be believers. But I am not a guardian over you."
They said, "O Shu'ayb, does your prayer command you that we should leave what our fathers worship or not do with our wealth what we please? Indeed, you are the forbearing, the discerning!"

He said, "O my people, have you considered: if I am upon clear evidence from my Lord and He has provided me with a good provision from Him...? And I do not intend to differ from you in that which I have forbidden you; I only intend reform as much as I am able. And my success is not but through Allah. Upon him I have relied, and to Him I return.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 1
Indeed, God Almighty said in the story of Shu'ayb: "And I do not wish to oppose you to that which I forbid you" (Hud: 88). And from its meanings is that his action [fi'l] does not oppose his speech [qawl]; rather, he does not command a thing unless he is the first to act upon it.

a.g: And O my people, let not [your] dissension from me cause you to be struck by that similar to what struck the people of Noah or the people of Hud or the people of Salih. And the people of Lot are not from you far away.
And ask forgiveness of your Lord and then repent to Him. Indeed, my Lord is Merciful and Affectionate."

They said, "O Shu'ayb, we do not understand much of what you say, and indeed, we consider you among us as weak. And if not for your family, we would have stoned you [to death]; and you are not to us one respected."
He said, "O my people, is my family more respected for power by you than Allah? But you put Him behind your backs [in neglect]. Indeed, my Lord is encompassing of what you do.

And O my people, work according to your position; indeed, I am working. You are going to know to whom will come a punishment that will disgrace him and who is a liar. So watch; indeed, I am with you a watcher, [awaiting the outcome]."
And when Our command came, We saved Shu'ayb and those who believed with him, by mercy from Us. And the shriek seized those who had wronged, and they became within their homes [corpses] fallen prone
As if they had never prospered therein. Then, away with Madyan as Thamud was taken away.

Indeed, among them is that in his love he is fearful, diminished under awe [hayba] and veneration [ta'zim]. One might think that fear opposes love, but it is not so. Rather, the perception of majesty [idrak al-'azama] necessitates awe [hayba], just as the perception of beauty [idrak al-jamal] necessitates love. And for the lovers [muhibbin] specifically, there are fears in the station of love [maqam al-mahabbah] that are not for others. Some of their fears are more severe than others. The first of them is the fear of being turned away [khawf al-i'rad], and more severe than it is the fear of the veil [khawf al-hijab], and more severe than that is the fear of being distanced [khawf al-ib'ad]. This meaning in Surah Hud is what turned the hair of the master of the lovers [sayyid al-muhibbin] white when he heard the saying of the Almighty: "So away with Thamud! So away with Madyan as Thamud was distanced!" And the awe [hayba] of distance [ba'd] and the fear of it only becomes immense in the heart [qalb] of one who has become intimate with nearness [qurb] and tasted it and taken delight in it. Thus, the mention of distance [ba'd] regarding those who are distanced turns the hair of the people of nearness [ahl al-qurb] white while they are in nearness. And one who is accustomed to distance [ba'd] does not yearn for nearness [qurb], nor does one weep from the fear of distance [khawf al-ba'd] who has not been granted the carpet of nearness [bisat al-qurb]. Then there is the fear of being made to stand [khawf al-wuquf] and the deprivation of increase [salb al-mazid], for We have previously established that the degrees of nearness [darajat al-qurb] have no end, and it is the right of the servant that he strive with every breath until he increases in it in nearness [qurb].

a.g: And We did certainly send Moses with Our signs and a clear authority
To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they followed the command of Pharaoh, and the command of Pharaoh was not [at all] discerning.
He will precede his people on the Day of Resurrection and lead them into the Fire; and wretched is the place to which they are led.
And they were followed in this [world] with a curse and on the Day of Resurrection. And wretched is the gift which is given.
That is from the news of the cities, which We relate to you; of them, some are [still] standing and some are [as] a harvest [mowed down].

And We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves. And they were not availed at all by their gods which they invoked other than Allah when there came the command of your Lord. And they did not increase them in other than ruin.
And thus is the seizure of your Lord when He seizes the cities while they are committing wrong. Indeed, His seizure is painful and severe.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book3
Indeed, and His saying: **"And thus is the seizure [akhdh] of your Lord when He seizes the cities while they are wrongdoers. Indeed, His seizure is painful and severe."** {} And the Qur'an, from its beginning to its end, is a source of dread [makhawif] for whoever recites it with contemplation [tadabbur]. And if there were nothing in it except His saying, the Most High: **"And indeed, I am Forgiving [Ghaffar] to whoever repents and believes and does righteous work and then remains guided."** {} it would be sufficient, for He has made forgiveness [maghfira] contingent upon four conditions which the servant ['abd] is incapable of fulfilling individually. And more severe than it is His saying, the Most High: **"So as for one who repents and believes and does righteous work, then perhaps he will be among the successful."** {} And His saying, the Most High: **"That He may ask the truthful about their truth."** {} And His saying, the Most High: **"We will attend to you, O you two weighty ones."** {} And His saying, the Mighty and Majestic: **"So did they feel secure from the plan [makr] of Allah?"** {} the verse, and His saying: **"And thus is the seizure [akhdh] of your Lord when He seizes the cities while they are wrongdoers. Indeed, His seizure is painful and severe."** {} And the fear [khawf] of the Prophets, despite the bounties [ni'am] that overflowed upon them, was only because they did not feel secure from the plan [makr] of Allah, the Most High: **"So none feels secure from the plan of Allah except the losing people."** {}

a.g: Indeed in that is a sign for those who fear the punishment of the Hereafter. That is a Day for which the people will be collected, and that is a Day [which will be] witnessed.
And We do not delay it except for a limited term.
The Day it comes no soul will speak except by His permission. And among them will be the wretched and the prosperous.
As for those who were [destined to be] wretched, they will be in the Fire. For them therein is [violent] exhaling and inhaling.
[They will be] abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord should will. Indeed, your Lord is an effecter of what He intends.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book5
Indeed, know that those among the predecessors [salaf] who sought treatment are not limited, but a group of the great ones [akabir] also abandoned treatment. Perhaps it is thought that this is a deficiency, because if it were a state of perfection [kamal], the Messenger of God ﷺ would have abandoned it, for the state of another in reliance [tawakkul] cannot be more complete than his state. And it has been narrated from Abu Bakr, may God be pleased with him, that it was said to him: "Shall we call a physician for you?" He said: "The Physician [al-tabib] has already looked upon me and said: 'Indeed, I do what I will.'"

a.g: And as for those who were [destined to be] prosperous, they will be in Paradise, abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord should will - a bestowal uninterrupted.

So do not be in doubt, [O Muhammad], as to what these [polytheists] are worshipping. They worship not except as their fathers worshipped before. And indeed, We will give them their share undiminished.

And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture, but it came under disagreement. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been judged between them. And indeed they are, concerning the Qur'an, in disquieting doubt.
And indeed, each [of the believers and disbelievers] - your Lord will fully compensate them for their deeds. Indeed, He is Acquainted with what they do.
So remain on a right course as you have been commanded, [you] and those who have turned back with you [to Allah], and do not transgress. Indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol3 book2a
Indeed, since the true middle [al-wasat al-haqiqi] between the two extremes is of the utmost subtlety—indeed, it is finer than a hair and sharper than a sword—it is no wonder that whoever is established upon this Straight Path [al-sirat al-mustaqim] in the world [al-dunya], will cross over a path like it in the Hereafter [al-akhira]. And rarely does a servant [al-'abd] become free from inclining away from the Straight Path—I mean the middle [al-wasat]—such that he does not incline to one of the two sides, and thus his heart [qalb] becomes attached to the side to which he inclined. And because of this, he is not free from some punishment and from passing through the Fire, even if it be like the flash of lightning. Allah, the Exalted, has said: "And there is none of you but will come to it. This is, with your Lord, a decree which must be accomplished. Then We will save those who feared Allah [ittaqaw]"—meaning those whose nearness to the Straight Path was greater than their distance from it. And due to the difficulty of uprightness [al-istiqamah], it is incumbent upon every servant to supplicate to Allah, the Exalted, in every day seventeen times in his saying, "Guide us to the Straight Path," since the recitation of the Opening Chapter [al-Fatihah] is obligatory in every unit of prayer. It has been narrated that one of them saw the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, in a dream and said, "I said, O Messenger of Allah, 'Surah Hud has aged me.' Why did you say that?" He, peace be upon him, said, "Because of His saying, the Exalted: 'So remain upright as you have been commanded.'" For uprightness upon the evenness of the way is of the utmost subtlety. But a person must strive to draw near to uprightness if he is not capable of its true reality [haqiqatiha].

a.g: And do not incline toward those who do wrong, lest you be touched by the Fire, and you would not have other than Allah any protectors; then you would not be helped.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

j2 k04
And do not incline [tarakunu] toward those who do wrong [zalamu]. It is said: Do not be pleased with their deeds. For if you are in a state of strength such that their ropes [hibal] are not increased by that, then there is no harm in taking.

a.g: And establish prayer at the two ends of the day and at the approach of the night. Indeed, good deeds do away with misdeeds. That is a reminder for those who remember.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 10
Indeed, the soul [nafs] is by its nature inclined toward the pleasures of the world [dunya]. So if the servant [abd] directs half of his times to the arrangements and permissible desires of the world, and the other half to acts of worship [ibadat], the side of inclination toward the world is weighted, because it agrees with his nature, since the time is equal. How can they be balanced when the nature [tab'] is a weight in favor of one of them? For the outward [zahir] and the inward [batin] cooperate in the matters of the world, and the heart [qalb] becomes pure and single-minded in seeking it. As for turning back to acts of worship, it is forced, and the sincerity [ikhlas] of the heart and its presence [hudur] therein are not secure except at some times. So whoever wishes to enter Paradise without reckoning, let him immerse all his times in obedience [ta'a]. And whoever wishes for the scale of his good deeds [hasanat] to be weighted and the balances of his good works to be heavy, let him occupy most of his times in obedience. If he mixes a righteous deed with an evil one, his affair is perilous, but hope is not cut off, and pardon from the generosity [karam] of Allah is awaited. Perhaps Allah, the Exalted, will forgive him by His bounty [jud] and generosity. This is what has been unveiled to the observers by the light of insight [nur al-basira]. If you are not of its people, then look to the address of Allah, the Exalted, to His Messenger and take it by the light of faith [nur al-iman]. For He, the Mighty and Majestic, has said: "And establish prayer [salat] at the two ends of the day and at the approach of the night. Indeed, good deeds do away with misdeeds." In this divine command is a clarification that establishing the prayer at the two ends of the day and at the approach of the night, with the good deeds it contains, does away with misdeeds [sayi'at], purifies the heart from the stains of sins, and places the servant in the arena of acceptance [qabul] and divine pleasure [ridwan]. For good deeds remove the effect of misdeeds and bring about forgiveness [maghfira]. So let this be evidence of the necessity of watching over the times and filling them with regular litanies [awrad] on the path of constancy, to achieve success [fawz] in the Final Abode [dar al-akhira].

a.g: And be patient, for indeed, Allah does not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good.

So why were there not among the generations before you those of enduring discrimination forbidding corruption on earth - except a few of those We saved from among them? But those who wronged pursued what luxury they were given therein, and they were criminals.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

j2 k09
Indeed, if only there had been among the generations [qurun] before you people of remaining virtue [uli baqiyatin], forbidding corruption [fasad] in the earth... (Quran 11:116). Thus, He made clear that He destroyed all of them except a few among them who were forbidding corruption.

a.g: And your Lord would not have destroyed the cities unjustly while their people were reformers.
And if your Lord had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they will not cease to differ.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

j4 k07 old
Indeed, they will not cease to be in disagreement [mukhtalifin], every faction rejoicing in what is with them. And for that [li-dhalika] I created them.

a.g: Except whom your Lord has given mercy, and for that He created them. But the word of your Lord is to be fulfilled that, "I will surely fill Hell with jinn and men all together."
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book3
Indeed, Allah the Exalted has said: "And the Word of your Lord has been fulfilled: 'I will surely fill Hell...'" (11:119) {the verse}. So how can one not fear what has been decreed as true in Pre-Eternity [al-azal], nor hope to recover from it? For if the matter were fresh, hopes would extend to a stratagem within it. But there is nothing except submission [al-taslim] therein, and inferring the hidden decree [al-sabiqah] from the manifest, apparent causes upon the heart [al-qalb] and the limbs.

a.g: And each [story] We relate to you from the news of the messengers is that by which We make firm your heart. And there has come to you, in this, the truth and an instruction and a reminder for the believers.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 8
Indeed, We have made firm your heart [fu'ad] with it. So let the servant [al-'abd] reckon that Allah has made firm his heart [fu'ad] with what He narrates to him of the states of the Prophets and their patience [sabr] upon harm and their steadfastness [thabat] in the religion [al-din] in anticipation of the victory of Allah, the Exalted.

a.g: And say to those who do not believe, "Work according to your position; indeed, we are working.
And wait, indeed, we are waiting."

And to Allah belong the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth and to Him will be returned the matter, all of it, so worship Him and rely upon Him. And your Lord is not unaware of that which you do.
